radiographic_examinations.findings: Enhancing lesion, 2 cm in diameter, on the sciatic nerve, extending from the ischial tuberosity to the deep peroneal nerve.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Repeated MRI study showed that the thickening of the sciatic nerve increased in diameter to 3.6 cm.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: MRI scanning of the brain and cervical, thoracic, and lumbar spine
radiographic_examinations.findings: No abnormalities of the brain, bilateral enhancing lesions in all cervical neural foramina, with cord compression at C1–2, C2–3, and C4–5.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased pain and foot drop on the left developed.

radiographic_examinations.date: About one year after starting treatment with gabapentin
radiographic_examinations.findings: Bilateral enhancing tumors at each level with cord compression at C1–2 level. C4–5 cord was displaced into the right canal.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: MRI of the thoracic and lumbar spine
radiographic_examinations.findings: Expanded nerve roots bilaterally at every level without cord compression; moderate stenosis of the canal at the L4–5 level.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Computed Tomographic (CT) scan of the abdominal area
radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple tumors involving the pelvic and paraspinal nerves and multiple subcutaneous masses.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Diagnostic MRIs through spine, lumbosacral plexus, and brain
radiographic_examinations.findings: Large masses along multiple bilateral cervical nerve roots with severe compression of the cervical spinal cord at the C2 level.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Multiple neurogenic tumors consistent with neurofibromas or schwannomas.
